chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Eli Benjamin Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eli Benjamin Peterson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Eli Benjamin Peterson was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Eli Benjamin Peterson was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall contact the Iron County Sheriff's Department at (715) 561-2440 within 10 business days of sentencing to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall also pay the surcharge for same.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eli Benjamin Peterson

records.addlTxt: 1:20 p.m.  Defendant Eli Benjamin Peterson in court.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Colleen Jane Locke appeared by Zoom video means for Defendant Eli Benjamin Peterson.   Court calls all cases.  Agreement has been reached.  Atty Locke states agreement.  Court questions def.  Def is satisfied with representation from Atty Locke.  Court cites charges and penalties in 16CF18, Counts 3 and 4.  Def understands.  DA makes motion to dismiss all other counts in 16CF18 on def's plea to two Counts as referenced and 16TR32, OLC.  Court grants motion to dismiss other counts, citations and other criminal case.  Def pleads NC per Atty Locke.  Parties stipulate to probable cause.  Court finds factual basis to find def guilty.  Court goes through PLQ with defendant and rights he is waiving.  Def understands.  Court explains elements of charges.  Def understands.  No coercion to enter plea agreement.  Atty Locke is satisfied def is knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently pleading.  Court finds def knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently pleads and understands rights and consequences of pleas.  Def pleads NC to  Counts #3 and #4 in 16CF18.  Court accepts pleas and finds def guilty and imposes judgment of conviction.  DA addresses court before sentence to be imposed.  Court questions if Marsy's Law has been complied with.  DA indicates has been complied with.  Atty Locke addresses Court.  Def exercises right of allocution.  Court sentences as follows:  On Count #3, $463.50, 7 days ICD with credit for time served.  Def also to make arrangements with ICSD to provide DNA sample.  As to Count #4, Court imposes $463.50.  Def also pleads NC to citation for Left of Center.  Court finds def guilty and imposes $263.50.  Adj.  1:43 p.m.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 21, 2020 at 01:15 pm.

9:46 a.m.  Defendant Eli Benjamin Peterson appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Matthew J Tingstad appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Colleen Jane Locke appeared by Zoom/video means for Defendant Eli Benjamin Peterson.  Court calls cases.  16CF18, 20CF3, 16TR31-34.  Def has no objection to appearing via phone.  Court cites appearances.  Per DA, parties haven't spoken much.  Per Atty Locke, jail portion proposed is too steep.  Per DA, couldn't proceed on an OWI.  Case to be scheduled for a PLEAS on 7/21 at 1:15 p.m.  Adj.  1;51 p.m.  klr

DA provides background of case.  Court questions parties if there is a resolution.  All cases to track together.  PLEAS to be adjourned.  DA will refax letter to Atty Locke re resolution.  Case to be rescheduled for July 13th at 1:30 p.m. (all cases).  20CF3 to be set for Initial Appearance and others to be set for PLEAS.  Adj.  1:39 p.m.  klr

Initial appearance to be scheduled for 12/9/19 at 10:30 a.m.  $1,000 Cash bond set with same conditions as previous bond.  Def understands, provides new address to Court.  Warrant is quashed.
